title: Exercises for Developing the Vertical Axis in Yoga.
first_phrase: This text is about physical exercises aimed at achieving a better connection between body and mind. The previous tokens have described different exercises that focus on stretching, breathing, and relaxing different parts of the body. The last part (200 tokens) focuses on the "total bilateral stretch" exercise, which involves lifting one arm while pulling the other down, feeling the tension in the spine rather than just the arms. The text also mentions the symbolic meaning of the vertical direction in human energy and sexuality and suggests exercises to connect the dimensions of "heaven and earth." The author emphasizes the importance of remembering the mind and body's unity and addressing mental tensions for a better posture.

last_phrase: In conclusion, developing the vertical dimension of our being through physical and sexual practices as well as connecting with the dimensions of earth and sky can lead to a rediscovery of our primal biological selves. By working on our physical presence, we can release tensions and malpositions caused by our thoughts and emotions, leading to a better understanding and perception of our bodies as a whole. This development of our inner energy is crucial for cultivating the "sun within us" and requires consistent and gradual training.
